name: SupportJoshuaAndMarisa
_source: speak;Joshua;Hey, I hear you're good with a sword...
speak;Joshua;It's a pleasure.|By the way, you ever hear this?

speak;Joshua;Well, I guess it was popular for a while, way back when.|But when two swordsmen met on the battlefield-even allied swordsmen-|they would duel it out to test one another's worth with the blade.|So what do you say?|Don't you think it's time to revive this tradition?
speak;Marisa;You want me to kill you?
speak;Joshua;No, no, no.|I'm not saying we have to fight to the death!|It's just a simple test of skill.
speak;Marisa;...Fine.|As long as I get a chance to whet my blade's appetite.
speak;Joshua;Er...|Great!|Now, what say we make this more interesting?|If I win, you owe me, and if you win, then I owe you.
speak;Joshua;...I'm not quite sure yet.|How about...|Ah, yes.|How about you owe me a favor.
speak;Marisa;But it doesn't matter.|I'm not going to lose to you.
speak;Joshua;Whoa!|Hold your horses!|Where's the hurry?|Let's do this another day.|After all, I like to savor the anticipation a little bit.
speak;Marisa;I don't get it, but fine.
speak;Joshua;Great!|We're all set then.|Next time we meet, we cross swords.|Deal?
speak;Marisa;There's nothing to anticipate.|You're simply going to lose.
speak;Joshua;Well, I don't know about that.|See you later.|I'm looking forward to it.
speak;Joshua;Whew...|After a match like that, I can be happy with a tie!
speak;Joshua;Heh...|Thanks.|But remember, I was at a slight disadvantage, so...

speak;Marisa;I must admit, I did hold you at a slight disadvantage.|However, we are closely matched, despite our incompatible styles.|I simply couldn't land a decisive blow.|But it was all worthwhile.|After all, I've learned, and that is worth far more than any wager.
speak;Joshua;I see.|You're a quick one, aren't you?|How did you get that good?
speak;Joshua;You live for the sword, eh?|I prefer rolling the dice to swinging the sword, you know?

speak;Joshua;Whew...|I thought you'd never ask.|You're asking how I got hooked on gambling, right?|Let me see...|There's not much to tell.|I guess by the time I realized it, it was already too late.|I'd grown bored of everything before I discovered gambling.|But then I saw it-gambling was like life, in short little bursts.|Life itself is just one big gamble!|That's how I see things.
speak;Marisa;I don't know anything about gambling, but it was a good duel.|We must try this again soon.
speak;Joshua;What, with no wager?|That doesn't sound very fun.
speak;Joshua;You mean that?|Then we'll have another bet.|I'll win next time.|See you later.
speak;Joshua;Whew...|Looks like I won this time.
speak;Joshua;No, you're just having a bad day.|And it's not like I had a decisive victory this time.|I'd say we're still just about even.
speak;Marisa;All that matters is that I didn't win.|You won the bet.|What do you want me to do?
speak;Joshua;Oh, you remembered our last bet!|That makes me happy.|All right, here goes...
speak;Joshua;I want you to be my partner for a while...|How's that sound?
speak;Joshua;Don't get the wrong idea.|I just meant for training.|And gambling.
speak;Joshua;Well, I suppose, but there's still a point to it all.
speak;Joshua;If I train with you, I'm going to become a better swordsman.|And if we train together, maybe we'll each learn something.

speak;Joshua;And there's something that I want to do soon when the war is over.|It's something that can't be done in a single day or overnight.|You could probably call this the biggest gamble of my entire life.|I'm going to have to hone my skills, and I'll need someone to help me.|What do you say, Marisa?|Won't you lend me a hand?
speak;Marisa;I'm good for fighting, and not much else.
speak;Joshua;You think?|I doubt that's true.|Well, think about it.
speak;Joshua;I know this is a gamble, but...|gambling is my hobby.
speak;Marisa;I won't.|But try to keep it interesting, all right?

speak;Joshua;Heh.|Then I'll do my best to keep you entertained.|And remember what I said...|Life is a gamble.|You never know what'll happen.|But don't worry.|I'm sure you won't be bored.|Besides, how often do you meet someone you can spar with?|Not to mention someone who can actually beat you!
